page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Around Horncastle the average farm has about 200 hectares. The main crops are winter wheat, sugar beet and oil seed rape. The farmer we spoke to has 32 hectares of land and grows winter wheat, barley and half an acre of potatoes to sell locally. He also grows sugar beet for the factory at Bardney. The busiest time is at harvesting between July and October. Most farmers have the facilities to store grain but some with small farms have to sell straight off the combine harvester. After harvesting, the farmer prepares his land for drilling again. Seed is sown early in the year and vegetables are planted out in spring. Most farmers, therefore, have to take their holidays during the winter months.
